alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 2:57PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW SUNDAY INTO MONDAY... Guidance has begun to converge on a frontal wave moving up from the south Sunday through Monday. Areas along the Icy Strait corridor and the northern panhandle are expected to be the main areas effected by accumulating, wet, heavy snow followed by a transition to rain. For areas near Icy Strait, accumulating snow is expected to begin Sunday morning with a transition to a wintry mix and rain through late Sunday night. The northern panhandle is expected to stay as snow through Sunday before a transition to a mix of rain Monday except for higher elevations along the highways. Greatest uncertainty in the forecast remains in snow totals. The area of greatest snowfall will be along the boundary of cold and warm air, and this band will be moving northward through Monday afternoon. However, exact details on how fast the band will move, how far north it will move, and how much moisture will be present will determine which area receives the greatest snow accumulations. At this time, we are expecting between 3-6 inches over 24 hours. Check back for updates on this evolving weather system as we continue to evaluate the atmospheric conditions that could lead to winter weather impacts.
